Description: Pottery ostracon with 9 lines of text on one side containing a tax receipt.
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Egypt, probably from the Theban Region
Bibliographic references: Biedenkopf-Ziehner 2000a / Koptische Ostraka I: Ostraka aus dem Britischen Museum in London (167-170, pl.16)
Delattre 2002 / Le reçu de taxe O. Brux. Inv. E. 375 (no. 2 (p.364-65))
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (82881) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/82881)
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: Robert de Rustafjaell (sold at Sotheby's on 19.12.1906)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Brit.Mus.Copt. II 15 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
